results.title: Statins Reduce Intratumor Cholesterol Affecting Adrenocortical Cancer Growth.
results.text_hl: Collectively, these data demonstrate that a reduction in intratumor @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ content prevents @CHEMICAL_Estradiol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004958 @@@estradiol@@@ production and inhibits mitochondrial respiratory chain-inducing apoptosis in @<m>DISEASE_Adrenocortical_Carcinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018268 @@@ACC@@@ cells. Inhibition of mitochondrial respiration by @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ represents a novel strategy to counteract @<m>DISEASE_Adrenocortical_Carcinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018268 @@@ACC@@@ growth.

citations.NLM: Trotta F, Avena P, Chimento A, Rago V, De Luca A, Sculco S, Nocito MC, Malivindi R, Fallo F, Pezzani R, Pilon C, Lasorsa FM, Barile SN, Palmieri L, Lerario AM, Pezzi V, Casaburi I, Sirianni R. Statins Reduce Intratumor Cholesterol Affecting Adrenocortical Cancer Growth. Mol Cancer Ther. 2020 Sep;19(9):1909-1921. PMID: 32546662
